definition: to run into/to meet (unexpectedly)/to bump into
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Use formal greetings when you meet teachers.
Luchy repent for his own affairs, have never thought to mulan had met.
sentences.chinese: 呂希爲自己的事情懺悔，沒想到讓木蘭碰見了。

sentences.english: An Arab was walking along in the desert when he met two men.
sentences.chinese: 一個阿拉伯人正獨自在沙漠中走，這時他碰見兩個人。

sentences.english: So I'm meeting all kinds of walks of life, and it's awesome.
sentences.chinese: 所以我碰見的是各行各業的人，棒極了。

sentences.english: i never dream to meet you here.
sentences.chinese: 我做夢也想不到會在這兒碰見你。

sentences.english: Let it be the one thing our hearts are set on, seeking, and finding, and meeting God.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們的心放在這上面尋找，尋見，並碰見神。

sentences.english: Bad managers are a dime a dozen but a good one is difficult to find.
sentences.chinese: 壞的老闆簡直是多如牛毛，碰見一個好的真難。

sentences.english: Just met Zhao Chuanji wear suits to the street.
sentences.chinese: 到街上剛好碰見趙傳奇穿的西裝革履。

sentences.english: I never thought will meet u here.
sentences.chinese: 我做夢也想不到會在這兒碰見你。

sentences.english: Avoid seeing people who make unreasonable demands on your time .
sentences.chinese: 避免碰見在你工作時間裏提出不合理要求的人。

sentences.english: We met a man with a baby goat two weeks ago.
sentences.chinese: 兩週前，我們碰見一個帶小山羊的男人。

sentences.english: I was about to leave when I ran into Mr White.
sentences.chinese: 我剛要走就碰見了懷特先生。

sentences.english: So special that even the people I met tends to be special.
sentences.chinese: 連出門後碰見的人都特別了。

sentences.english: Meet a black uncle whom I photo the several days ago.
sentences.chinese: 居然碰見熟客了，那是前些天我拍的一個黑人大叔。

sentences.english: Should you run into Sunny, tell her she owes me a letter.
sentences.chinese: 萬一你碰見桑妮，告訴她她欠我一封信。

sentences.english: Sun Yao meets a tourist outside a hotel in China.
sentences.chinese: 孫耀在中國的一家旅館外面碰見一個旅遊者。
